head.title: Nursing Homes: We Can Do More

hedline.hl1: Nursing Homes: We Can Do More

abstract.p: Frank Riessman letter on Sept 25 editorial calls for self-help groups for nursing home residents; drawing

block.p: Re ''Better Care in Nursing Homes'' (editorial, Sept. 25):

Your editorial is in the camp of supply-side approaches to improving care through more and better trained health care workers. Re ''Better Care in Nursing Homes'' (editorial, Sept. 25):

Your editorial is in the camp of supply-side approaches to improving care through more and better trained health care workers. I would like to suggest that a demand-side approach be included: namely, a combination of more and better trained workers along with a self-help emphasis among staff and patients.
Demand-side strategies would include a role for the residents of nursing homes, including participation in self-help groups.

At present, nursing home residents are demoralized and conditioned by a trained incapacity to help themselves. This needs to turn around, and increasing the supply of professionals, though important, will not help empower residents in this way.
The writer, a nursing home resident, contributes to selfhelpweb.org, the National Self-Help Clearinghouse.
